alert.note: Alert for La Porte; St. Joseph; Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 7:44AM EST until February 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Yellow River at Plymouth affecting Marshall, Starke and St. Joseph IN Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kankakee River at Davis affecting Starke, La Porte and St. Joseph IN Counties. .The combination of snowmelt and 1 to 2 inches of rainfall led to rises on area rivers. Rises could shift ice in the river that could lead to ice jams. This forecast is based on unobstructed flow and does not factor additional rises associated with ice jams. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kankakee River at Davis. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of low lying agricultural areas begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CST Friday /7:00 AM EST Friday/ the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 9.5 feet and begin rising again Monday evening. It will rise to 9.9 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
